title: Rangers ready for testing trip to Ross County - Premiership's most northerly outpost
text:
For Steven Gerrard and some of his recent recruits, Rangers’ visit to Ross County on Wednesday evening will be an introduction to one of the Scottish Premiership’s singular arrangements – a trip to the league’s most northerly outpost just after the clocks have gone back.

Those newbies who played last Thursday against Porto in the Estadio Dragao – albeit only half-full – and against Motherwell before 50,000 at Ibrox on Sunday, will find the Global Energy Stadium, aka Victoria Park, a significant contrast.

“I’ve been there on a few occasions when I was working for TV, so I know Dingwall and Roy MacGregor (County chairman) really well,” said Rangers’ assistant manager, Gary McAllister. “I know the hospitality and what kind of club it is but for the gaffer and a lot of the boys it will be the first time they’ve been up there.

“It’s a nice ground, a good pitch and there’ll be a lot of Rangers fans, so we’re looking forward to it. The games just keep coming and players like that. They much prefer to play games than train – well, as a player I did and I’m sure the lads are the same.

“We’ve been to St Mirren and Livingston and Hamilton, so they have witnessed these types of stadium. What I will say, having seen it only on TV, is that the pitch there looks great. That’s our main concern – a good playing surface – and that makes it great.

“It’s always been really good because they invest a few quid in it and that’s typical of Roy. He’s a class act.

“They’re sixth in the league and they’ll be happy with their start but we’ve got to ask the boys to go again and go again and repeat. We go there off a good result against Motherwell, coming back from a goal down, so it’s just about keeping it going.”
description: For Steven Gerrard and some of his recent recruits, Rangers’ visit to Ross County on Wednesday evening will be an introduction to one of the Scottish Premiership’s singular arrangements – a trip to the league’s most northerly outpost just after the clocks have gone back.
